channel.title: Anderson Research Group @ Cornell University
channel.description: This is the website for the Anderson Research Team at Cornell, where we investigate decarbonization of energy systems through renewable resources and demand side technologies.

item.title: Congratulations to Alonso Alegre Bravo on his award!
item.description: Alonso will use the award to support his preliminary field work in Latin America this summer. Congratulations Alonso!

item.title: Cornell Chronicle article featuring Shikhar's project
item.description: This Cornell Chronicle article features Shikhar’s work with Dr. Madhur Srivistava (Assistant Research Professor in Chemistry at Cornell) on an app to help consumers save money by helping the utility shift consumption. You can read about it [here] https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/01/cornell-nyseg-pilot-app-help-consumers-moderate-electricity-use

item.title: Kenji's new preprint is available from Oxford Open Energy!
item.description: This paper looks at long term climate simulations in concert with the NYS CLCPA energy system decarbonization plan to explore the challenges that might arise in an operational setting over the middle-to-long term. The pre-print is available here, pending typesetting by the journal. Congrats Kenji!

item.title: New paper published by Alonso Alegre Bravo
item.description: Alonso’s new paper explores issues of rural electricity access in regions of the Global South. The article appears in Applied Energy. Congratulations Alonso!

item.title: Vivienne Liu presents at HICSS 56
item.description: Vivienne Liu presented her conference paper A Spatiotemporal Analysis of New York State Grid Transition under the CLCPA Energy Strategy at the 56th HICSS Conference on Maui. The paper is available here. Congrats to Vivienne on a great presentation and to the whole team (including Amandeep Gupta and Kenji Doering) on their conference publication!

item.title: New paper by Shriya Nagpal!
item.description: Shriya Nagpal’s recent article explores new methods for designing networks that are robust to oscillations that may arise from renewable energy resources. The article appears in IEEE Transactions on Control of Network Systems. Congrats to Shriya and collaborators Gokul Nair and Prof. Francesca Parise on a job well done!

item.title: Vivienne's paper on the NYS synthetic grid published
item.description: Vivienne Liu’s recent article develops a synthetic but realistic repressentation for the NYS electric grid with publicly available data. The article appears in IEEE Transactions on Power Systems. The model and data can be found in Github Repository.

item.title: Welcome back to the lab Shikhar!
item.description: After a few years at Avangrid, we are excited to welcome Shikhar Prakash back to the team as a Ph.D. student. Welcome back Shikhar!

item.title: Postdoctoral Position Available
item.description:
Cornell BEE is advertising for a postdoc! The position is part of a USDA-funded, interdisciplinary team looking at agricultural-to-energy transitions in New York State. The postdoc will be co-supervised by Lindsay Anderson, Scott Steinschneider, and myself, and will have the opportunity to interact widely with other faculty.

We’re interested in developing an energy demand model which is sensitive to nonlinear climate dynamics, as well as applying a climate stress test to a model of the New York State power system, which the postdoc would also help to develop. There are many interesting questions at the nexus of energy, water, and climate that the hired candidate would be able to explore.

A successful candidate would have:

  • A Ph.D in power and energy systems or operations research;
  • Programming skills in at least one major programming language (e.g. R, Python, Julia, etc.)
  • Experience and proficiency with statistical modeling;
  • Good communication skills and an interest and ability in developing working relationships with stakeholders.

The anticipated start date is April 1, 2021, though this is flexible. To apply, go to Academic Jobs Online. And feel free to email me if you have any questions!
